#summary Embed Mono(.NET) in your Java applications in 5 minutes, download included
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

[http://mono-project.com/What_is_Mono Mono is a multi-platform CLR/.NET implementation] written and maintained by [http://www.novell.com/ Novell].

It makes it possible to run .NET programs on Linux, MacOS X and other unices.

A very cool feature of Mono is its [http://www.mono-project.com/Embedding_Mono Embedding C API], which is an ideal target for use from Java using [http://jnaerator.googlecode.com/ JNAerated] wrappers.

= Downloads =

Preliminary binary download : [http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/Mono.jar Mono.jar] (contains Java sources, their compiled classes and the JNAerator runtime - including JNA).

= Quickstart =

Read this blog entry [http://ochafik.free.fr/blog/?p=165 .NET WinForms HelloWorld from Java using embedded Mono + JNAerator].

It explains how to use the [http://code.google.com/p/nativelibs4java/source/browse/#svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/examples examples].

= Building =

First, checkout [http://code.google.com/p/nativelibs4java/source/browse/#svn/trunk/libraries/Mono Mono's project file from nativelibs4java] :
{{{
svn checkout http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/ Mono
}}}

Go to the `Mono` directory and download JNAerator :
{{{
wget http://ochafik.free.fr/Java/jnaerator.jar
}}}

Then launch JNAerator :
{{{
java -jar jnaerator.jar Mono.jnaerator
}}}

You'll get a neat [http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/Mono.jar Mono.jar library wrapper such as this one].
